resources.string: We present 100 native plant species found in the páramo of Cajas, Azuay province, Ecuador. Páramo is a unique ecosystem dominated by bunch-grasses above the tree-line in the Andes mountains. The plants are not necessarily the most common species, but they are showy, easy to find, and relatively easy to identify. We believe that by recognizing and naming wild plants the user will gain an increased appreciation of the flora of Ecuador and will strive to protect them and the páramo environment.

This project is a collaboration between the Missouri Botanical Garden and the Azuay Herbarium (Universidad del Azuay) with Parque Nacional Cajas. Project contact: carmen.ulloa@mobot.org. Designer L.M. Unda, Quito (feedback to: .....). All rights reserved.
